There is a report that assembles information from the configured processors=
 (or at least those that have a report).

I've been wondering if it would b=
e a good idea to have a similar 'scope report' that assembled reports from =
all the DecideRules that are in effect (assuming a report is provided).

Th=
is could (for example) be a tally of how often a given rule has given a REJ=
ECT verdict etc.

More specifically, if you have a series of regexes to fil=
ter out 'badness', you could have the MatchesListRegexDecideRule report the=
 number of matches made against each. This would give some information abou=
t the effectiveness of the regex.

Of course we'd need to ensure that the p=
erformance of the 'standard' modules is not degraded, but if the general fa=
cility was in place it would be easy to add custom DecideRules if you have =
more extensive needs. Some of the reporting could also be optionally enable=
d.

Any thoughts and comments on this idea would be welcome. If positive I'=
ll assemble a more detailed RFE.

- Kris
